Reviews.Content: The best kept secret in Florence       One of the most charming hotels ever
Reviews.Author: Coloradoblond

Reviews.Content: Neutral Hotel was clean, (relatively) inexpensive, but rooms were small and in need of a refresh. Hotel is located next to the old synagogue, which is about a 10-15 minute walk from the Duomo...not too bad. We chose to stay here for the price, and because other friends had already reserved. If you can find somewhere in closer in town for the same price, that might be a better option.Breakfast was great, staff was pleasant enough, and room was always spotless when we returned in the evenings.Flat screen TV with CNN.Overall, I'd rate this property neutral!
Reviews.Author: pnagrows

Reviews.Content: Okay but noisy! The room was clean, breakfast was okay, and the location was fine, but the big big problem was the noise. Maybe we were very unlucky, but neither my husband nor I slept due to either the road noise or the drunk and noisy teenagers above and next door. You could hear everything they said and the constant slamming of doors kept us up even when wearing earplugs!
Reviews.Author: Shamu1967

Reviews.Content: Hotel Arizona a great experience My husband and I booked the hotel through Expedia based on price and location. We were pleasantly surprised by how nice it was. Our room was fine (European rooms, as you know, are small by American standards). The hotel was very clean and had an old world atmosphere. The staff (it is family owned and run) was very nice and accommodating. The location was great: in a very interesting neighborhood, lots of great restaurants and shops, but quiet. Florence was a wonderful experience for us, and the Hotel Arizona was a major part of it.
Reviews.Author: RIcouple

Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay in Florence       Street view from window.
Reviews.Author: jadrianb

Reviews.Content: Would NOT Recommend! I was NOT a fan of this hotel. Besides the fact it wasn't in my favorite location, the room was VERY small. Even smaller - the BATHROOM! The entire room may have been about 2-feet by 4-feet and the shower was TINY. My wife and I stayed there three nights and could not wait to move on to our next hotel. The breakfast was also not as good as what we had in our other stops.If you have other choices, I would suggest you select those in Florence.
Reviews.Author: Rob CC

Reviews.Content: Fell In Love With Hotel And Owners  We absolutely fell in love with the hotel and the owners. The rooms are small but well furnished and very comfortable by American standards. Great A/C and attractively furnished. Even the ceilings are painted, I felt the need to photograph one. The family that owns it is very friendly and have the cutest black poodle named Bilba that had just had puppies, which I very much wanted to take home. The owner brought the babies in from home just to show them to us, and we rolled around on the carpet playing with them. The hotel is convenient to many nearby sights, we walked through the streets at night and had a blast. There were lots of young people walking around at all hours. It was a great value, and I recommend it highly!
Reviews.Author: WiniPu4

Reviews.Content: Small Place But Clean and Good Location I had read some really negative reviews but stayed anyway based on the price, photos, and location. Okay, upon arrival, I did'nt feel welcome, but got checked in. The room was small. I mean the bed and the wall had about one foot and that is obvious in the photos, but the location was good and the room was well kept up and clean. The breakfast was pretty good. Out of the 4 hotels I stayed at in Italy during my 10 day tour, this was number 4 at the bottom of my list. The hot water heater broke and many guests left. They told me that if I stay they will reduce my nightly fee by 15% and I can help my self to the mini bar. The facility was fixed the next day, in fairness it was a Sunday and I had hot water on Monday and Tuesday nights. They did honor a 10% discount and complained about my two waters from the mini bar so I argued the point and won but I felt uncomfortable. The lcoation was walking distance form the main attractions and museums and the hop on hop off bus actually stopped 2 blocks away so that was convenient. The area was located in the Jewish ghetto so it was safe. I would not stay there again because of the unfriendly staff and small room, I would rate it as average or okay becasue the price was competitive but not great given teh size of the room. I was impressed by the 19 LCD TV in my room but again not recommended for someone that likes more space. I basically had to stay on the bed when I was in the room as it took up the whole room and it was a twin sized bed (really small room, not kidding). I had an unpleasent feeling when I left becasue of the hassels with the water heater and discount and the unfriendly staff but its okay. Does'nt deserve a harsh review because they did honor some sort of discount when I could have been out of luck having pre paid, but not sure if it would have been worth it to pay a little more for another place. Yeah, maybe so......
Reviews.Author: senza210

Reviews.Content: great find. I had read reviews before I went and expected a good,if basic, hotel, but I found it the best hotel (of four) I have stayed in over the past 20 months ,in Florence.It is in very quiet surroundings on a pleasant street but is only a ten minute,or less, walk from the Duomo ,Santa Croce and the main tourist areas. At the end of the day you can get either a regular bus which stops at the end of the street,or the Line C eco bus which stops about a one minute walk from the hotel ! Great for sore feet. As regards the accommodation, the hotel is clean,bright and modern ,the breakfast more than adequate,and there is a small lounge area with Internet and papers/magazines.My single room was the standard size for a single ,nicely furnished and the air con worked. The bathroom was the smallest I think I have ever seen but was newly refurbished and was fine,(if cramped) with a proper enclosed shower and complementary toiletries. As another guest had remarked the walls are on the thin side but are so in many modern hotels-that's why I always travel with earplugs.Being a residential area there is not a cafe on every corner, but there are two in the immediate vicinity of the hotel ,the trattoria Acaddi about four minutes walk on the Borgo di Pinti is good and in the other direction,about four minutes and off the P.Ambrogio are some more. I have stayed in higher rated hotels but this is the best and good value of them all with pleasant staff.I would certainly stay here again.
Reviews.Author: ashlea

Reviews.Content: Would Stay Again I just returned from Florence and I stayed at the Arizona Hotel. It's within walking distance of the sights and great restaurants that aren't tourist traps. The room was small but I didn't mind because I wasn't cramped and wasn't in my room most of the time anyway. Because the staff were friendly and helpful, the great location and clean rooms, the next time I return to Florence, I'm definitely going to book at the Arizona Hotel.
Reviews.Author: bgray5267

Reviews.Content: Like Returning Home I returned again in December to Florence to visit my daughter and again booked the wonderful Hotel Arizona. When I arrived, Aldo and Danieli greeted me so warmly that I felt I was in my Italian home away from home. I was even assigned the same room I had a year ago-- Room 29--so it truly was familiar. This year they added a new flat screen TV in each room. And their mascot poodle now has a puppy. Their service for my 2 week stay was flawless. They even went overboard and surprised me with a birthday present. This hotel has a special place in my heart and I would highly recommend it. Be sure to ask for a non-smoking room!
Reviews.Author: AuntPuddles

Reviews.Content: A Real Treat!               More photos
Reviews.Author: CourtneyLove

Reviews.Content: Great location, short walk to almost everything We were 1 of 3 couple that stayed at the Arizona. The price was very good for the time of year, and it was only about a 10 minute walk to the Duomo. Its a bit farther to get to the shopping district, but you can always jump in a cab, only a few Euro. The rooms had all your basics: private, CLEAN bathroom, mini bar, and daily maid service. All in all, a good deal for the price. After all, who is spending their whole day in the hotel room?
Reviews.Author: bacaporale1

Reviews.Content: Great small hotel in convenient location! Great little hotel in a convenient location in Florence. We stayed there for 3 nights at Hotel Arizona and really liked it. We were within walking distance of the Duomo, etc. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, giving us good instructions and helping us with restaurant reservations. The room was a quad room that was cozy but fine. The a/c worked well, which was very important since the weather was really hot and humid. Breakfast was plentiful with great variety served buffet style in a very nicely appointed eating area and bar.There were some great restaurants right in the area, too.We'd stay at Hotel Arizona again!
Reviews.Author: otterpop

Reviews.Content: Very nice, but misleading... Overall, I liked the hotel's location, rooms and breakfast. The staff seemed very friendly, but didn't want to and/or couldn't honor the terms of agreement. The summary on hotels.com and other sites stated complimentary parking and internet. They attemped to charge me for both. For starters, there was no internet access in my room as advertised, no big deal, I'll just use my computer in the lobby. There was no wireless access there like the front desk clerk said, so he let me use the computer in the lobby. I tried to use it and it required a password and he charged for the password (6 euros/half hour) and it turned out to be dial-up access.By the way, the only reason I wanted to use the internet in the first place was to show the staff the websites advertising free internet and free parking. After the websites came up 30 minutes later, they agreed to finally give these things to me free.Then 3 days later when I checked out, they had 6 euros for internet and 60 euros for parking on my bill. I explained to the clerk what happened earlier. She said the first clerk was wrong and I have to pay. I demanded she call that clerk on the phone. She wouldn't, so I asked to speak with the manager and she told me she was the manager.After a long conversation explaining to her that management is responsible for employeess making misleading or false statements and/or the information advertised on the websites they are booked through, she finally gave me my car keys so I could leave without paying these extra charges.On a side note, the maps of Florence in the lobby with prices of entry were incorrect as well. We went to several place including the Boboli gardens only to find out that the entrance fee was 8.5 euros, not 2. The prices weren't just incorrect, but very incorrect.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Excellent mid-budget hotel, good for kosher travelers The hotel is perfect for observant Jewish travelers - it's on the same street as the famous Florence Jewish synagogue (the one with the big dome that you see in pictures of the skyline), a kosher restaurant, a Chabad Lubavitch center and a very small kosher grocery store. The hotel itself also offers kosher meals for groups of a certain size (for a sizable fee, of course).Generally, the hotel was pretty nice. Breakfast is included, and they offer a limited but tasty selection. There is a small lobby where you can relax, with one computer that has Internet access (as of May 2006, 2 euro for a half-hour, 4 euro for an hour, and 6 euro for 2 hours). The rooms are simple and small but clean, and the bathrooms modern (a SMALL shower, not a bathtub). They didn't waste much money on decorations, but the rooms are reasonably coordinated and attractive. The location was good - we weren't in the heart of tourist-land (or anywhere near the train station, which is an area we thought was sketchy), but were definitely able to walk to all of the tourist sites. (It's maybe a 10 minute walk to the cathedral, etc.). The service was helpful but again, limited. (For example, they happily call you taxis when you request it, and helped set us up with a tour of Sienna/San Gimignano for a day.) It's definitely a budget hotel, which is something we didn't know going in. (Personally, I would prefer to pay more and stay somewhere nicer, but this turned out fine in the end, since the service, location and cleanliness were all good.) One weird European thing (which personally, I hate) - you have to leave your key (yes a key, not an electronic keycard) at the front desk when you leave the hotel.
Reviews.Author: butterfly00

Reviews.Content: nice hotel good location The Hotel Arizona is located in a relatively central location we found we could walk everywhere from the hotel and found the walk back from restaurants at night to be quite charming through the narrow Florence streets. (A map might be a good idea until get bearings!)The road outside was quite busy though not a main road by any means there was some traffic noise from it, mainly Italians on their beloved scooters, this could have being added to because there was road works outside the hotel during our stay which meant all traffic had to turn outside our hotel because the through road was blocked.The rooms were very clean and decorated to a high standard with good facilities (flatscreen TVs mini bar safe etc) bathrooms were clean and had a modern and tasteful suite fitted. The staffs were very friendly and helpful and spoke pretty good English (well much better than my Italian anyway!!) they organised taxis got the train time tables for us etc...The Breakfast was ur typical continental buffet served in a charming breakfast room Overall an above standard hotel, offering reasonable value for money, in a good location
Reviews.Author: nc-dublin

Reviews.Content: Good Value       The bed
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: this is a nice hotel This is a nice hotel, rooms are nicely decorated, in a central but quiet location, with a nice breakfast room and polite people. The toilet is quite small but it is new, nice and clean.I would recommend this hotel.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Charming and friendly We stayed at the Arizona Hotel in the early summer of 2004. How funny to travel from the US to Italy and stay in Arizona! The room had a frescoed ceiling; the fact that we were down the street from the statue of David was just a bonus. We were charmed by the little restaurant where breakfast was served as an included amenity--and a real breakfast, not just Continental. For a small family hotel, the front desk help was incredibly helpful in every regard--English spoken, helped us find a local restaurant that had wonderful and inexpensive food, helped us get bus info and train reservations, and called a cab to bring us to the train on our way home. They even had a hotel dog that sat outside awaiting guests (a sweet and obedient gray poodle.) I would gladly choose this homey place to live in if I could move to Florence! Located in a central place, a great walk to many places of interest.
Reviews.Author: mrsming

Reviews.Content: Very Nice Hotel I was surprised that no other reviews are shown for this hotel.We were very pleased. The location is right next to the synagogue.The room was lovely (with fresco on ceiling). The service andbreakfast where good. I would recommend the Arizona.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Un hotel genial!       techo
